candidates.title: Implement deserialize for Uuid
candidates.body: This PR covers an issue previously opened by me, i.e. `Uuid` deserialization.

candidates.title: Make errors more fine-grained
candidates.body:
This PR makes a large variety of error variants.

This approach removes most allocations in error construction.

Closes #72.

candidates.title: Move to GitHub actions
candidates.body:
This PR moves `avro-rs` to GitHub actions.

Here's an example of what a CI run looks like, using an earlier version of this
branch against my fork of `avro-rs`: https://github.com/cpcloud/avro-rs/pull/1/checks.

GitHub actions is IMO far easier to use, more flexible with many useful
plugins, and you don't have to leave GitHub to use it.

I've added 4 builds (stable, beta, night, and an MSRV somewhat arbitrarily set
at 1.40) and 1 security audit workflow.

I'm happy to do the security audit job in another PR if that's preferable.

TODO:

- [x] Update `README.md` with correct Build Status badge

candidates.title: Move from failure to thiserror
candidates.body:
Closes #115

This is still a WIP branch, with lots of TODOs and some things about
thiserror I still can't wrap my head around. However, the heavy-lifting
is done, the failure crate has been removed from the list of
dependencies and compilation, tests, benchmarks and linting are all
green.

The two biggest things I have yet to figure out are:
1. How to deal with the errors manually defined in ser.rs and de.rs:
   they are publicly available and as soon as I touch anything I hit
   cryptic serde errors
2. How to make errors like TryFromIntError part of more abstract ones
   like ParseSchemaError, which could have a source error or just a
   String description.

candidates.title: Bump digest library to 0.9 and its dependencies
candidates.body:
This also includes a bump for sha2 library. As it stands, the trait changed,
meaning this will actually be a breaking change for anyone using the fingerprint
functionality of `avro-rs`.

candidates.title: Generate README.md with `cargo-readme`
candidates.body:
By bringing in `cargo-readme` the canonical source for README.md documentation
will be the library documentation, also shown in docs.rs.

This commit moves some documentation only in the README into `src/lib.rs` and
therefore docs.rs also gets a good update.

The downside to this is that there's yet another tool being depended upon and a
new template file `README.tpl`. All in all a minor downside I think.

candidates.title: Make writer block size configurable
candidates.body:
This PR makes block size configurable in `Writer`.

The approach uses the [`typed_builder`]() crate to enable this feature.

After this PR you can call the `block_size` method to construct a new `writer`
using `typed_builder`:

```rust
let mut writer = Writer::builder().block_size(100).writer(writer).schema(&schema).build();
```

Without calling the `block_size` method the default value of `16000` is used.

candidates.title: Port benchmarks to criterion
candidates.body:
This PR ports micro benchmarks to criterion.

Criterion works on stable, and is actively maintained and developed.

It also provides much more useful benchmarking data than libtest does.

Finally, it keeps track of the last run and gives useful output indicating possible regressions.

repo.name: avro-rs
repo.description: Avro client library implementation in Rust
